results.title: Teenagers create an animated film
results.creator_credit: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documents the efforts of junior high school students in producing an animated film, “Gone with the antennas”. Shows the step-by-step process of how an animated film can be produced with a minimum of expense by a youthful group.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films

results.title: Teenage whiz kids
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mokin Productions and CBS News
results.brief_description:
A CBS News presentation, this film views some gifted children in Washington. Covers the following points regarding gifted children: early entry into tertiary education, emotional maturity, the attitudes of peers, parents, and teachers and the types of problems encountered with early entry to universities and the resultant support needed.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Teenage pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows the reaction of a family when one of the daughters reveals that she is pregnant. Presents the decisions to be made concerning both the mother-to-be and the coming child, ignoring the responsibility of the father and concentrating on the girl’s problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: the Movie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Barron, David Chan, Simon Fields, Kim Dawson, Limelight Entertainment and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The four baby turtles who strayed into radioactive waste and mutated to become human sized talking reptilians with a hearty appetite for pizzas and rock music were raised by the Japanese ninja master water rat Splinter in the sewers of New York City. Now the dreaded Shredder is recruiting teenagers to commit a wave of robberies which has the city in panic. So it’s up to the four fearless turtles to save the day with a little help from feisty TV reporter April. Cowabunga! Based on the comic-book creation of Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: the secret of the ooze (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Pressman, David Chan, Kim Dawson, Thomas K. Gray, Gary Propper and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The four hip superheroes Raphael, Leonardo, Michaelangelo and Donatello continue their bodacious adventures as they find a new sewer home and with the help of curvaceous TV reporter April O’Neil, Professor Jordon and Keno, the pizza delivery boy they battle the Foot gang and other mutant villains to discover their origins, to save New York and to keep the mutant-causing green ooze from falling into evil hands.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
results.brief_description: The player chooses from one of the four Ninja Turtles: Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello, and Raphael. After Shredder kidnaps the Turtles’ friend April O’Neil and their mentor Splinter, they must give chase, save their comrades, and defeat the evil Shredder.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

results.description: Konami’s Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles was an iconic side-scrolling brawler of the arcade era that brought the mutants in a half-shell to life for button-mashing adventure.
description_for_label: Konami’s Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles was an iconic side-scrolling brawler of the arcade era that brought the mutants in a half-shell to life for button-mashing adventure.

results.title: Teenage movies in competition
results.brief_description: Contains excerpts from twelve award-winning films made by young filmmakers “out to communicate ideas…to make a personal statement… to examine a civic problem…to educate or just to have fun.” All films submitted for the “Teenage Movies Competition” run by Kodak.

results.title: Teenage girl
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell, Leon Clore, Basic Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A sixteen-year-old girl’s interests and successive choices of careers are shown humorously. Indicates the opportunities waiting for school-leavers of both sexes.

results.title: Teenage crises: fateful choices
results.creator_credit: Nick Doob, Linda Atkinson and Human Relations Media
results.brief_description: This hard-hitting documentary addresses many of the significant problems encountered by today’s youth: addiction, violence, pregnancy, AIDS and depression/suicide. “Teenage crises” attempts to shake up the notion of teen invincibility by talking to young people who have come through hard times, including Olympic gold medal swimmer Nelson Deibel, an ex-drug addict. Stresses the importance of finding positive role models and being secure enough to make the right choices.
